body_content.explanation: a place where people live and work, containing many houses, shops, places of work, places of entertainment, etc., and usually larger than a village but smaller than a city:
examples: He was born in the small town of Castleford, in Yorkshire.
We stayed in the best hotel in town.
the main road into/out of town

body_content.explanation: the part of a town where most of the businesses are:
examples: I'm going into/to town at lunchtime to do some shopping.
I met Charles while I was in town.

body_content.explanation: the most important city or town in a country or area:
examples: We went up to town to see a play.
Many people commute into town (= London) from Essex.

body_content.explanation: the place where you live or work:
examples: I'm leaving town for a few days.
Barbara is out of town on business this week.

body_content.explanation: the people who live in the town:
examples: The whole town is/are hoping that their team will win the final tomorrow.

body_content.explanation: a town or city, rather than the countryside:
examples: I've always lived in the town.
